panels.description: This panel shows the amount of data currently stored in the WiredTiger cache. This data is in its uncompressed format and differs from how the data is stored on disk or in the file system cache. This value will always be lower than the counter shown in the *WiredTiger Max Cache Size* panel.
panels.title: WiredTiger Cache Usage

panels.description:
This is the maximum size that the WiredTiger cache can grow to and can be changed from the default value by setting the `storage.wiredTiger.engineConfig.cacheSizeGB` value in the config file or passing in the `--wiredTigerCacheSizeGB` parameter on the command line.

You can read more about [setting the WiredTiger maximum cache size](https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/configuration-options/#storage.wiredTiger.engineConfig.cacheSizeGB).
panels.title: WiredTiger Max Cache Size

panels.description: This is the amount of the file system memory in use.
panels.title: Memory Cached

panels.description: This panel shows how much of the system memory is free.
panels.title: Memory Available

panels.description: WiredTiger internal transactions
panels.title: WiredTiger Transactions

panels.description: Data volume transfered per second between the WT cache and data files. Writes out always imply disk; Reads are often from OS filebuffer cache already in RAM, but disk if not.
panels.title: WiredTiger Cache Activity

panels.description: Data volume handled by the WT block manager per second
panels.title: WiredTiger Block Activity

panels.description: Internal WT storage engine cursors and sessions currently open
panels.title: WiredTiger Sessions

panels.description: A WT 'ticket' is assigned out for every operation running simultaneously in the WT storage engine. "Available" = hardcoded high value - "Out".
panels.title: WiredTiger Concurrency Tickets Available

panels.description: Operations queued due to a lock.
panels.title: Queued Operations

panels.description: The time spent in WT checkpoint phase. Warning: This calculation averages the cyclical event (default: 1 min) execution to a per-second value.
panels.title: WiredTiger Checkpoint Time

panels.description: Least-recently used pages being evicted due to WT cache becoming full.
panels.title: WiredTiger Cache Eviction

panels.description: Configured max and current size of the WT cache.
panels.title: WiredTiger Cache Capacity

panels.description: WT internal write-ahead log operations.
panels.title: WiredTiger Log Operations

panels.description: Data volume moved per second in WT internal write-ahead log.
panels.title: WiredTiger Log Activity

panels.description: Number of records appended per second in WT internal log.
panels.title: WiredTiger Log Records

panels.description: Mixed metrics: Docs per second inserted, updated, deleted or returned on any type of node (primary or secondary); + replicated write Ops/sec; + TTL deletes per second.
panels.title: Document Changes

panels.description: This panel shows the number of objects (both data (scanned_objects) and index (scanned)) as well as the number of documents that were moved to a new location due to the size of the document growing. Moved documents only apply to the MMAPv1 storage engine.
panels.title: Scanned and Moved Objects

panels.description: Unix or Window memory page faults. Not necessarily from mongodb.
panels.title: Page Faults

panels.description:
This shows the number of active connections on the server. Keep in mind the hard limit on the maximum number of connections set by your distribution.

You can read more about the [connection numbers](https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/administration/analyzing-mongodb-performance/#number-of-connections).

targets.expr:
max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_connections{service_name=~"$service_name", state="current"}[$interval]) or 
max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_connections{service_name=~"$service_name", state="current"}[5m]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_connections{service_name=~"$service_name", state="current"}[$interval]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_connections{service_name=~"$service_name", state="current"}[5m]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_connections{service_name=~"$service_name", state="current"}[$interval]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_connections{service_name=~"$service_name", state="current"}[5m])

panels.title: Connections

panels.description: This shows the number of open cursors for each shard in the cluster. A cursor in MongoDB is a pointer to the result of a given query that can be iterated over. By default a cursor times out after 10 minutes.

targets.expr:
max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_metrics_cursor_open{service_name=~"$service_name"}[$interval]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_metrics_cursor_open{service_name=~"$service_name"}[5m]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_cursors{service_name=~"$service_name"}[$interval]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_cursors{service_name=~"$service_name"}[5m]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_metrics_cursor_open{service_name=~"$service_name"}[$interval]) or 
max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_metrics_cursor_open{service_name=~"$service_name"}[5m]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_cursors{service_name=~"$service_name"}[$interval]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_cursors{service_name=~"$service_name"}[5m])

panels.title: Cursors

panels.description:
Percent of Memory Available
Note: on Modern Linux Kernels amount of Memory Available for application is not the same as Free+Cached+Buffers
panels.title: Memory Available

panels.description: RAM + SWAP
panels.title: Virtual Memory

panels.description: Sum of disk space on all partitions. Note  it can be significantly over-reported in some installations
panels.title: Disk Space

panels.description: Lowest percent of the disk space available
panels.title: Min Space Available

targets.expr: clamp_max(((avg by (mode) ( (clamp_max(rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",mode!="idle"}[$interval]),1)) or (clamp_max(irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node_name=~"$node_name",mode!="idle"}[5m]),1)) ))*100 or (avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{node_name=~"$node_name", mode!="total", mode!="idle"}[$interval]) or avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{node_name=~"$node_name", mode!="total", mode!="idle"}[5m]))),100)

panels.title: CPU Saturation and Max Core Usage
